Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip with one line of cord-marked decoration around shoulder and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394443) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394443)
